required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Study of Tirelizumab Combined With Cetuximab and Irinotecan in the Treatment of Recurrent, Refractory mCRC
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Clinical Study on the Efficacy and Safety of Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor Combined With Cetuximab and Irinotecan in the Treatment of Recurrent, Refractory and Metastatic Colorectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single arm, open phase II study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of tirelizumab combined with cetuximab + irinotecan in the treatment of Ras wild-type recurrent and refractory colorectal cancer. This study will include Ras wild-type colorectal cancer that failed at least second-line treatment in the past, including chemotherapy (oxaliplatin, irinotecan, fluorouracil) with or without targeted drugs (cetuximab, bevacizumab). 33 patients were planned to be treated with tirelizumab combined with cetuximab + irinotecan every 2 weeks. The enrollment time is expected to be 12 months and the follow-up is 24 months.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months after the last subject participating in
primary_outcome.description: proportion of patients with complete and partial remission in the best efficacy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months after the last subject participating in
secondary_outcome.description: the best efficacy is the proportion of patients with complete remission, partial remission and stable disease

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months after the last subject participating in
secondary_outcome.description: time from the start of medication to the initial progression of the disease

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 36 months after the last subject participating in
secondary_outcome.description: time from the start of medication to death

arm_group.description: tirelizumab combined with cetuximab and irinotecan

intervention.description: tirelizumab（an anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody）+cetuximab（monoclonal antibody against EGFR）+irinotecan
